name: 勞維俊
objective: 透過細讀虛構的作品與觀察現實中的建築與城市風景，學生將學習檢視城市的不同風貌。本課程旨在培養學生將自身對城市的感受化為文字，並加以分析批判。除了口頭報告和書面作業，課程將要求學生以英文製作一部有關城市的短片。如有機會，將安排學生實地考察台北或其他城市。
schedule:
Students will examine different features of a city including architecture and urbanscape represented in both works of fiction and in reality. This course aims to train students’ abilities to transform their experiences in the city into words, and to analyze aspects of the city critically. Apart from presentations and writing assignments, students are required to make a short film in English about the city. A field trip to parts of Taipei or other cities may be arranged.

Course Outline: 
　　　　
I: Introduction: 
Weeks 1-3: Introduction 
Blake, ‘London’ (poem)
The Skywalk Is Gone (2002) (short film) (dir. Tsai Ming-liang)
Poe, ‘Man of the Crowd’ (short fiction)

II. Into the Nineteenth-century 
Week 4-5: Dickens’s London 
Dickens, Bleak House (ch.1)
Dickens, Little Dorrit (ch.3)

Week 6-8: Paris and St. Petersburg
Baudelaire, ‘The Swan’ & ‘To a Woman Passing By’ in The Flowers of Evil (poems) 
Manet, A Bar at the Folies-Bergre. 1881-1882. Oil on canvas. 96 x 130 cm. Courtauld Institute Galleries, London. (painting)
Nikolai Gogol, ‘Nevsky Prospect’ (short fiction)

Week 9: Mid-term Examination 

Week 10-12: Engels, ‘The Great Towns,’ in The Condition of the Working Class in England (essay)

IV. The Cinematic Cities 

Week 13-14: Space and alienation
La Notte (The Night) (1961) (dir. Antonioni)


Week 15-16: Modernism and destruction
24 City (2008) / Still Life (2006) / The World (2004) (dir. Jia Zhang-Ke) 

[Week 15: short film shooting plan due]

Week 17: Screening of short films

Week 18: Final Examination
scorePolicy:
Teaching Approach

Students are required to read all the assigned texts, including literary, filmic and theoretical works. They should attend lectures, participate in discussions in tutorials, give a presentation, and write two essays. A field trip (voluntary) may be arranged.

Assessment

Tutorials 　　　　　　　　　　　　10%
Short film production　　　　　　　　30%
Mid-term examination　　　　　　　　30%
Final examination　　　　　　　　　　30%    
　　　　　　　　　　　　　　100%
